column1: Yesterday, @entity1 and @entity0 went to the zoo with their mom. They left the house right after breakfast so that they would be there when the zoo opened. Once inside, they raced to see the monkeys swinging around their cages. There were even two baby monkeys!  The girls also enjoyed feeding birds in the walk-in bird cage. The birds were very interested in picking seeds from the popsicle stick that @entity1 held out to them. Next, it was time to stop for ice cream. Each girl chose a small cup of soft ice cream. @entity1 chose a swirl of chocolate and vanilla and @entity0 had chocolate. Ice cream at the zoo was the perfect treat on a hot summer day.  The best part of the girls' visit was the giraffe area. They walked past rhinos and tortoises to get to the giraffe area which was on a raised deck. The giraffes stretched their necks up to the deck to eat leaves and hay that were placed there for them. @entity1 and @entity0 bought special crackers to feed to the giraffes. @entity1 liked that she could pet the giraffes when they reached out to grab the crackers with their long tongues. @entity0 liked to watch the giraffes, but did not want to feed one herself. After feeding the giraffes, the girls left the zoo, hot and tired and ready to return soon!
@placeholder type of animal did @entity1 and @entity0 visit first at the zoo
